data.title: Columnize it!
data.solution:
read -r n

for (( i=0; i<$n; i++ )); do
    IFS= read -r line
    echo $line
done | column -t -o " "
data.statement: Format input into multiple columns. Columns must be left-aligned and separated by a <<single space>>. Every item in a column must be filled with the minimum number of space characters necessary.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
3
AB C DE
FG HIJ KL
M NO PQR
testCases.testOut:
AB C   DE
FG HIJ KL
M  NO  PQR

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
2
ABCDE FGH IJ
KL MNOPQ RSTUV
testCases.testOut:
ABCDE FGH   IJ
KL    MNOPQ RSTUV

New status [ OK     ]

urna        lectus     malesuada tortor   quis

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 10
All [[lines]] contain the same number of items and have no successive spaces.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read line:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of lines to columnize
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> [[lines]] to columnize

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Format input into multiple columns. Columns must be left-aligned and separated by a single space. Every item in a column must be filled with the minimum number of space characters necessary.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of lines to columnize
Next n lines: lines to columnize
Output
n lines: Lines columnized
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 10
All lines contain the same number of items and have no successive spaces.
Example
Input
3
AB C DE
FG HIJ KL
M NO PQR
Output
AB C   DE
FG HIJ KL
M  NO  PQR
